Code.definition: a systematic compilation or revision of law or legal principles that is arranged esp. by subject
Code.origin: [Old French, from Medieval Latin codex , from Latin caudex codex tree trunk, set of wood writing tablets, book]

1.definition: a systematic compilation or revision of law or legal principles that is arranged esp. by subject

sub_terms.a: one that contains the law of a specific jurisdiction or topic promulgated by legislative authority [U.S.] [of Massachusetts Regulations] [building ] see also Important Laws in the back matter compare,,
sub_terms.b: one that serves as a model for legislation but is not itself a law [Model Penal]

1.Code: of Massachusetts Regulations] [building ] see also Important Laws in the back matter compare

2.definition: a set of rules or regulations that is promulgated by a body (as a professional organization) and that regulates its industrial or professional practices [ABAof Professional Responsibility]
